Your account verification is under process

This payment gateway is powered by Instamojo, which allows you to collect your customers’ payment directly into your bank account without any delay, (unlike the default payment gateway provided by Boost). With this add-on acticvated on your boost website your customers see that they are paying to your business and not to boost.
You, have either not renewed this add-on or have not added this add-on ever before. To enjoy it’s benefits, go to add-on store to activate it for your boost business website.

First item\n
Second item\n
Third item

Boost currently supports Instamojo as ONLY OPTION as a custom payment gateway. If you want to activate it, get this add-on from our marketplace, and then for it’s activation, we’ll ask you to either create Instamojo account yourself or else we will help you do KYC and help you setup this account.\n\n
Please note that boost just acts as a fecilitator helping businesses like you to get most out of your Business website.\n\n
Boost in no way is associated with Instamojo or claim any kind of responsibility related to the custom payment gateway.\n\n
Instamojo logo or brand name belongs to it’s respective owners.\n\n
If you do not do the kyc, Instamojo has a monthly INR 10,000 limit. Once you complete the KYC this limit get’s removed.\n
I don\'t have an Instamojo account
Take Photo Of Your PAN Card

Decide what you want to call the catalog tab on your website and the default tax % for your all services.
It is NOT ADVISED to change it very often. With every such change, the URL of catalog page changes, which may cause search related issues and a drop in search rank leading to less traffic.

Tax slabs are a rate at which any service is taxable (determined by GST council of India). This is used to back calculate the final paybale amount while placing an order at the checkout page on your website.
This will be used as default tax rate for any service in your catalog in case you’ve not entered any specific tax% for that product.

Boost 360 payment gateway is a premium service which ensures payment protection to you and your customers. With this your customers will be able to pay you upfront digitally by all popular payment methods such as Credit Card, Debit Card, UPI etc.. We charge 3% as convenience fees which includes bank charges for providing the Boost payment gateway services)

Tax slabs are a rate at which any product is taxable (determined by GST council of India). This is used to back calculate the final paybale amount while placing an order at the checkout page on your website.

Where can your customers pick up this order from?
24th street, City Center, HSBL Colony, Kolkata, West Bengal-100009
Boost 360 does not handle shipping. To deliver the orders to customers’ location, you need to arrange for home delivery via a local delivery partner or any trusted shipping company.

Set the default delivery fee (inclusive of taxes) that you want to charge for all orders requiring home delivery. Please note that the shipping charges will be taxed with the rate of that item which has the highest rate of tax in the order.
Above delivery fee will be charged for all home delivery orders irrespective or cart value.

means the liability to pay tax is on the recipient of goods or services instead of the supplier of such goods or services in respect of notified categories of supply. If you are providing any service or supplying any goods which are covered in the notification issued by the government to be covered in RCM, then you need not charge GST on your invoice instead your customer will have to pay GST on those services/goods and claim input tax credit)
I hereby declare that I’ve not yet registered my business for GST.

• Open a new tab in your browser.

• Go to domain provider’s setting and log in.

• Come back here for next steps

• On your domain provider’s site, go to ‘domains’ page.

• Find ‘samplebusiness.com’ and go to it’s control panel or settings panel.

• Find where you manage the domain’s settings. Look for a button or link with the words Manage, Manage settings, domain settings or something similar.

• In your domain settings, find the area where you manage or edit nameserver records, (help). This area could be called DNS settings, Nameservers, NS or similar. If you don’t see it immediately, try looking for a menu at the top or on the side of this page.

• Find your current nameservers. They look like this:
ns-cloud-d1.googleomains.com
ns-cloud-d2.googleomains.com
ns-cloud-d3.googleomains.com
ns-cloud-d4.googleomains.com
• On your domain provider’s site, replace your current nameservers with the <__> nameservers below, one at a time.\n\n• Remove previously written nameservers and add below shown 2 nameservers.
• Now you should have two above mentioned nameserver records. If you have others, just remove them.\n\n• Save your changes.
With a domain booked via Boost 360 gets you a free SSL (secure sockets layer) certificate. Please note that Boost 360 doesn’t provide any premium domain.

On your domain provider’s site, replace your current nameservers with the <____> nameservers below, one at a time.
Remove previously written nameservers and add below shown 2 nameservers.
Now you should have two above mentioned nameserver records. If you have others, just remove them.

In case you have a different website (for same business) connected to the domain that you own, you can integrate this website also as a sub-domain on that domain.
Since search engines recognize a domain that’s already in use, we recommend integrating any relatable domain name that you currently own.
A subdomain is a subdivision of a domain
